slides.title: Core Principles
slides.content:
# Core Visualization Principles ðŸŽ¯

## 1. Show the Data
- Data should be the focus
- Minimize distractions

## 2. Reduce Clutter
- Remove chart junk
- Every element should serve purpose

## 3. Integrate Text
- Clear titles and labels
- Context through annotations

## 4. Tell a Story
- Lead with insight
- Guide the viewer's eye

## 5. Accuracy
- Don't distort data
- Appropriate scales

> ðŸŽ¯ Good viz = Clear + Accurate + Purposeful!

slides.title: Visual Encoding
slides.content:
# Visual Encoding ðŸ”¤

Mapping data to visual properties.

## Pre-attentive Attributes

Perceived instantly (< 0.5 sec):

| Attribute | Good For |
|-----------|----------|
| Position | Most accurate |
| Length | Quantities |
| Color | Categories |
| Size | Quantities (limited) |
| Shape | Categories |

## Effectiveness Ranking

1. Position (most accurate)
2. Length
3. Angle
4. Area
5. Color saturation
6. Color hue

> ðŸ’¡ Use position when accuracy matters!

slides.title: Color Usage
slides.content:
# Using Color Effectively ðŸŽ¨

## Color Types

### Sequential
- Light to dark
- For ordered data

### Diverging  
- Two colors from midpoint
- For deviation from center

### Categorical
- Distinct colors
- For unordered categories

## Best Practices

- Limit to 5-7 colors
- Consider colorblind (8% of men)
- Use color purposefully
- Consistent meaning across charts

> âš ï¸ Test for accessibility!

slides.title: Common Mistakes
slides.content:
# Visualization Mistakes âŒ

## Don't Do This

- **3D charts** - Distort perception
- **Pie charts with many slices** - Hard to compare
- **Truncated axes** - Misleading
- **Dual axes** - Confusing
- **Rainbow color scales** - Inconsistent

## Do This Instead

| Mistake | Solution |
|---------|----------|
| 3D pie | 2D bar chart |
| Many pie slices | Horizontal bar |
| Truncated axis | Start at zero |
| Rainbow | Sequential palette |

> ðŸŽ¯ Simplicity wins!
